summary: The CFG captures the main control flow of the SimpleLoop contract including the for-loop structure, but has some structural differences due to EVM compilation optimizations and lacks explicit back-edge representation for the loop iteration.
missing_paths: Explicit loop back-edge from increment (i++) back to condition check (i < loops)
Loop increment block (i++) as separate node before jumping back to condition
extra_paths: Overflow check path (node 9) for number++ increment - Panic(0x11) revert on arithmetic overflow
Input validation revert path (node 6) for calldata parameter validation
observations: The for-loop is represented with condition check at node 7 (LT, ISZERO pattern) and body at node 8
Node 7 contains the loop condition (i < loops) with ISZERO to invert for conditional jump
Node 8 contains the loop body (number++) with SLOAD/SSTORE pattern
The loop back-edge is implicit - after node 8's arithmetic operations, control returns to node 7 via the missing increment path
Node 9 represents Solidity 0.8.x's built-in overflow protection for the number++ operation
The CFG correctly shows two function selectors: 0x0b7d796e (loop) and 0x8381f58a (number getter)
Node 10 represents the loop exit path when condition (i < loops) is false
The increment operation for loop counter i is embedded within the arithmetic overflow check flow rather than shown as separate node
Contract deployment checks (CALLVALUE check) are correctly represented in nodes 0-1
